newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss set terms on three-month money market claims.
newsitem.headline: Swiss set terms on three-month money market claims.

text.p: The Swiss federal government set terms on its latest 3.383 series of three-month money market claims auctioned Tuesday, which are to be paid for on Thursday, the Swiss National Bank said.
The issue, which raised 1.2 billion Swiss francs, was priced at 99.586 percent to yield 1.645 percent. It matures on July 24, 1997.
It also set a new series 6.384, for 182 days, maturing on October 30, 1997. The auction concludes April 29 and payment is on May 1.
